Name: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
HP Extras: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
Power 2 - Effect: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
Power 3 - Effect: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
Power 4 - Effect: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
Power 5 - Effect: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
Description: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

Name: # Animals
Description: Animals are mundane beasts, like those found in the real world.

Name: Eagle
Power 2 - Attack: The eagle flies up to 8. At one point during the movement, they can make one melee basic attack. Moving away from the target of the attack does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Name: Raven of Doom
Power 1 - Effect: 1d4+1 damage, and the target receives a -2 penalty to all attacks until the end of its next turn.
Power 2 - Effect: When a raven of doom is killed, all other ravens of doom within 2 squares gain a +4 bonus on attacks rolls until the end of their next turn.

Name: Giant Tarantula
Power 2 - Attack: Near burst 3;  the giant tarantula fires a cloud of stinging hairs from its back +4 vs. Ref; 1d4+2 damage, and the target is blinded until the end of the giant tarantula's next turn.

Name: Rattlesnake Swarm
Aura: *Aura 1:* The rattlesnake swarm makes a basic attack as a free action against each enemy that begins its turn in the aura.
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, and the rattlesnake swarm makes a secondary attack on the same target. *Secondary Attack:* +5 vs. Fort 1d6+1 poison damage, and persistent 2 poison damage.

Name: Sticky-Tongue Toad
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+4 damage, or 1d8+8 against a grappled target.
Power 2 - Effect: the target is grappled (until escape) and pulled adjacent to the giant frog.
Power 3 - Effect: The giant frog shifts 4 squares.

Name: Great Ape
Power 2 - Effect: The ape shifts 6 squares and makes a slam attack. If the attack hits, the target is pushed 1 square.

Name: Phantom Cat
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, and the phantom cat shifts 1.
Power 2 - Effect: The shadow cat teleports 5 squares, and then attacks, dealing an extra 2d6 damage and knocking the target prone.

Name: Poison-Tongue Toad
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+3 poison damage and the target is blinded until the end of the spitting frog’s next turn.
Power 3 - Effect: The spitting frog shifts 4 squares.

Name: Ragged Tooth Shark
Power 2 - Attack: The shark swims up to 8. At one point during the movement, they can make one melee basic attack. Moving away from the target of the attack does not provoke opportunity attacks.
Power 3 - Effect: A tropical shark gains +1 bonus to attack rolls and a +2 bonus to damage rolls against staggered enemies.

Name: Wisent Bison
Power 2 - Effect: The wisent can move up to its speed and enter a foe’s space. This movement provokes opportunity attacks, and the bison must end its move in an unoccupied space. When it enters a foe’s space, the bison makes a secondary attack
Power 2 - Secondary Attack: +5 vs. Reflex; 2d8+7 damage, and the target is knocked prone. Against prone creatures, this attack deals an extra 1d6 damage.

Name: Ancient Hermit Crab
Power 1 - Effect: 2d8+5 damage, and a Medium or smaller target is grappled (until escape).
Power 2 - Attack: Affects a target the hermit crab has grappled; +10 vs. Fortitude
Power 2 - Effect: 2d8+10 damage, and persistent 5 damage until the target escapes the grapple.
Power 3 - Effect: The hermit crab makes a charge attack with its spiny shell: +13 vs. AC; 3d6+5 damage, and the target is pushed 1 square. If the target is pushed against an immovable object, such as a wall, it is immobile and takes persistent 5 damage (save ends both).
Power 4 - Effect: 1d6+5 damage.

Name: Dog-faced Baboon
HP Extras: see also *bounding pounce*
Power 2 - Attack: The baboon shifts 8 squares and makes a bite attack. If the attack hits, the target is knocked prone.
Power 3 - Attack: Near burst 1; targets enemies +7 vs. AC
Power 3 - Effect: 1d10+5 damage.

Name: Scintillating Boa
Power 2 - Effect: 1d10+5 damage, the target is grappled, and the scintillating boa makes a secondary attack on the same target.
Power 2 - Secondary Attack: The scintillating boa attempts to swallow a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling; +10 vs. Fort; on a hit, the target is swallowed and restrained (no save) and takes 5 damage plus 5 acid damage on subsequent rounds at the start of the scintillating boa’s turn. The swallowed creature can make melee basic attacks with one-handed or natural weapons. If the scintillating boa dies, any creature trapped inside it can escape as a move action, ending that action in a square formerly occupied by the scintillating boa. If the scintillating boa fails to swallow a target, the target is still grappled, and the scintillating boa can attempt to swallow it on its next turn. However, if the target in no longer stunned, it cannot be swallowed, although it is still grappled.
Power 3 - Effect: the target is stunned (save ends). *Aftereffect:* The target is dazed (save ends).

Name: Quipper Swarm
Aura:
*Swarm Attack aura 1:* If an enemy begins their turn in this aura, makes a melee basic attack against them as a free action.
*Frenzied Aura aura 2:* The quipper swarm’s swarm attack aura increase to 2 squares the first time an adjacent enemy becomes staggered.
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+4 damage, and the target takes persistent 5 damage (save ends).

Name: Pleisiosaur
Power 1 - Effect: 3d6+6 damage, and target is weakened (save ends).
Power 2 - Attack: When a foe in reach gets up from prone; Reach 3; +13 vs. AC
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+6 damage and foe is pushed 3 squares.
Power 3 - Effect: 4d8+6 damage, and the target is knocked prone if it is Medium size or smaller.

Name: Tyrannosaur
Power 1 - Effect: 2d6+6 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 2 - Effect: The tyrannosaur makes a charge attack: +16 vs. AC; 2d6+12 damage, and the target is knocked prone and stunned (save ends).
Power 3 - Effect: Grappled target only; automatic hit; 4d6+6 damage.

Name: # Apefolk
Description: Apefolk are humanoids reminiscent of humankind's closest relatives: gorillas, orang utans and chimpanzees. Apefolk tend to form city-states, populated by philosophers, soldiers and slaves.

Name: Apefolk Legionnaire
Power 2 - Effect: 1d6+5 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: The legionnaire can make 2 short sword attacks against a staggered opponent.
Power 4 - Effect: When adjacent to at least 2 apefolk allies, the legionnaire receives a +1 bonus to all defenses.
Equipment: scale armor, heavy shield, short sword, three javelins

Name: Apefolk Infantry
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook
Power 2 - Effect: When adjacent to at least 2 apefolk allies, the apefolk infantry receives a +1 bonus to all defenses.

Name: Apefolk Signifier
Power 2 - Effect: 2d4+4 psychic damage.
Power 3 - Effect: all allies within the burst regain 5 hit points and all persistent effect upon the target end.
Power 4 - Attack: Near burst 3; target enemies +5 vs. Ref
Power 4 - Effect: 2d8+4 force damage, and the target is knocked prone.
Power 5 - Effect: the target is dazed and weakened (save ends both).
Power 6 - Effect: When adjacent to at least 2 apefolk allies, the signifer receives a +1 bonus to all defenses.

Name: Apefolk Centurion
Power 2 - Effect: The centurion can make 2 longsword attacks against a staggered opponent.
Power 3 - Effect: allies in the burst shift 3 squares. Allies that end up adjacent to the centurion gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls until the end of the centurion’s next turn.
Power 4 - Effect: When adjacent to at least 2 apefolk allies, the centurion receives a +1 bonus to all defenses.

Name: Apefolk Infiltrator
Power 2 - Effect: The infiltrator can make 2 short sword attacks against a staggered opponent.
Power 3 - Effect: the target is marked and grants the infiltrator combat advantage until the end of the infiltrator’s next turn.
Power 4 - Effect: The infiltrator deals an additional 2d6 damage on melee attacks against any target it has combat advantage against.

Name: # Dragon, Feathered
Description: Couatl, also known as feathered dragons, are dragons sent from the heavens to do good on earth. Despite their holy mission, they remain carnivores - and they hunger for the meat of those intellectually beneath them.

Name: Young Couatl
HP Extras: see also *energy leak*
Spd: 4, fly 8 (hover), overland flight 12; see also *flyby attack*
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, the target takes persistent 5 poison damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+4 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 3 - Attack: Affects a target the couatl has grappled; +6 vs. Fortitude
Power 3 - Effect: 1d8+8 damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the couatl’s next turn.
Power 4 - Effect: The couatl flies up to 8 squares and makes a melee basic attack at any point during the move without provoking an opportunity attack from the target.
Power 5 - Effect: 1d8+2 poison damage, and the target is weakened and takes persistent 5 poison damage (save ends).
Power 6 - Effect: The couatl’s breath weapon refreshes, and the couatl uses it immediately.
Power 7 - Attack: Near burst 5; targets enemies; +4 vs. Will
Power 7 - Effect: the target is blinded until the end of the couatl’s next turn. *Aftereffect:* The target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).

Name: Adult Couatl
HP Extras: see also *energy leak*
Spd: 4, fly 10 (hover), overland flight 15; see also *flyby attack*
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+5 damage, the target takes persistent 5 poison damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: 1d10+5 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 3 - Attack: Affects a target the couatl has grappled; +11 vs. Fortitude
Power 3 - Effect: 1d10+10 damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the couatl’s next turn.
Power 4 - Effect: The couatl flies up to 10 squares and makes a melee basic attack at any point during the move without provoking an opportunity attack from the target.
Power 5 - Effect: 1d10+3 poison damage, and the target is weakened and takes persistent 5 poison damage (save ends).
Power 6 - Effect: The couatl’s breath weapon refreshes, and the couatl uses it immediately.
Power 7 - Attack: Near burst 5; targets enemies; +11 vs. Will
Power 7 - Effect: the target is blinded until the end of the couatl’s next turn. *Aftereffect:* The target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).
Power 8 - Effect: The couatl becomes invisible until it attacks.

Name: Elder Couatl
Aura: *Detect Thoughts aura 10:* Couatl has a +2 bonus to all defenses against attacks from enemies in aura. Enemies in aura cannot use Stealth to hide from couatl; couatl receives +10 bonus on Insight when opposing Bluff checks made by creatures in aura.
HP Extras: see also *energy leak*
Spd: 6, fly 12 (hover), overland flight 18; see also *flyby attack*
Power 1 - Effect: 1d10+6 damage, the target takes persistent 10 poison damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+6 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 3 - Attack: Affects a target the couatl has grappled; +18 vs. Fortitude
Power 3 - Effect: 2d6+12 damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the couatl’s next turn.
Power 4 - Effect: The couatl flies up to 12 squares and makes a melee basic attack at any point during the move without provoking an opportunity attack from the target.
Power 5 - Effect: 3d6+4 poison damage, and the target is weakened and takes persistent 10 poison damage (save ends).
Power 6 - Effect: The couatl’s breath weapon refreshes, and the couatl uses it immediately.
Power 7 - Attack: Near burst 5; targets enemies; +16 vs. Will
Power 7 - Effect: the target is blinded until the end of the couatl’s next turn. *Aftereffect:* The target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).
Power 8 - Effect: The couatl becomes invisible until it attacks.
Power 9 - Effect: The couatl becomes incorporeal and teleports 12 squares. It remains incorporeal until the end of its next turn.

Name: Ancient Couatl
Aura: *Detect Thoughts aura 10:* Couatl has a +2 bonus to all defenses against attacks from enemies in aura. Enemies in aura cannot use Stealth to hide from couatl; couatl receives +10 bonus on Insight when opposing Bluff checks made by creatures in aura.
HP Extras: see also *energy leak*
Spd: 8, fly 14 (hover), overland flight 18; see also *flyby attack*
Power 1 - Effect: 2d6+9 damage, the target takes persistent 15 poison damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: 3d6+9 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 3 - Attack: Affects a target the couatl has grappled; +25 vs. Fortitude
Power 3 - Effect: 3d6+18 damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the couatl’s next turn.
Power 4 - Effect: The couatl flies up to 12 squares and makes a melee basic attack at any point during the move without provoking an opportunity attack from the target.
Power 5 - Effect: the target is stunned (save ends).
Power 6 - Effect: 4d6+5 poison damage, and the target is weakened and takes persistent 15 poison damage (save ends).
Power 7 - Effect: The couatl’s breath weapon refreshes, and the couatl uses it immediately.
Power 8 - Attack: Near burst 5; targets enemies; +23 vs. Will
Power 8 - Effect: the target is blinded until the end of the couatl’s next turn. *Aftereffect:* The target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).
Power 9 - Effect: The couatl becomes invisible until it attacks.
Power 10 - Effect: The couatl becomes incorporeal and teleports 12 squares. It remains incorporeal until the end of its next turn.

Name: # Dwellers in the Deep
Description: In cliffside caves and sunken ruins dwell strange beings.

Name: Deepfolk
Power 1 - Effect: 1d10+6 damage, and the deepfolk makes a secondary attack on the same target. *Secondary Attack:* +7 vs. Reflex; the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 2 - Effect: 2d8+6 damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the deepfolk’s next turn.
Power 3 - Effect: 1d8+3 damage, and the target is blinded until the end of the deepfolk’s next turn.

Name: Enthralled Servant
Power 1 - Effect: 1d4+5 damage, and the target is marked until the end of the encounter.
Power 2 - Effect: 1d4+5 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: A servant gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls if a target bears a mark from it or one of its allies.
Power 4 - Effect: If a servant gains any combat advantage against a target, all servants within 5 squares also gain combat advantage against the target.

Name: Half-Aboleth
Power 1 - Effect: 2d4+6 damage (2d4+14 on a critical hit), and the target is marked until the end of the half-aboleth’s next turn.
Power 2 - Effect: 1d4+2 damage, and the target is blinded until the end of the half-aboleth’s next turn.
Power 3 - Effect: 1d8+2 acid damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).
Power 4 - Effect: When attacking a marked target, the half-aboleth makes two attack rolls and uses the better result.
Power 5 - Effect: If a half-aboleth gains any combat advantage against a target, all half-aboleths within 5 squares also gain combat advantage against the target.

Name: Aquatic Gargoyle
Power 2 - Effect: The aquatic gargoyle gains resist all 25, regeneration 3, and tremorsense 10 (losing all other senses). The gargoyle can leave stone form as a swift action; otherwise it cannot act.
Power 3 - Effect: When the gargoyle leaves stone form, it gets a melee basic attack against all adjacent enemies and shifts 3.

Name: Transformed Servant
Power 1 - Effect: 1d10+6 damage, and the target is marked until the end of the encounter.
Power 2 - Attack: The transformed servant makes a charge attack while swimming: +16 vs. AC
Power 2 - Effect: 2d10+6 damage, and the target is stunned (save ends).
Power 3 - Effect: A servant gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls if a target bears a mark from it or one of its allies.
Power 4 - Effect: If a servant gains combat advantage against a target, all servants within 5 squares also gain combat advantage against the target.

Name: # Goblinoids
Description: Goblinoids include goblins, hobgoblins and bugbears.

Name: Wolf-Goblin
Power 1 - Effect: 1d10+4 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+2 necrotic damage, the target loses 1 healing surge, and the wolf-goblin regains 10 temporary hit points. In addition, for each successful feeding, the wolf-goblin gains a non-cumulative +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls until the end of its next turn.
Power 3 - Effect: 3d6+3 psychic damage, and the target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).
Power 4 - Effect: A wolf-goblin can assume the shape of a giant black dog or a goblin-like humanoid. It loses its bite attack in goblin form.
Power 5 - Effect: A wolf-goblin may shift up to 4 squares as part of any move action it takes.

Name: Greater Wolf-Goblin
Power 1 - Effect: 2d6+6 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 2 - Effect: 4d6+3 necrotic damage, the target loses 2 healing surges, and the greater wolf-goblin regains 10 hit points. If a target is reduced to 0 hit points in this fashion, the greater wolf-goblin gains a cumulative +2 bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and all defenses until the end of the encounter.
Power 3 - Effect: 4d6+4 psychic damage, and the target is dazed and weakened (save ends both).
Power 4 - Effect: A greater wolf-goblin can assume the shape of a giant black dog or a goblin-like humanoid. It loses its bite attack in goblin form. Each time a greater wolf-goblin changes shape it can shift 3 squares as a free action.

Name: # Golems
Description: Golems are magically created automatons of great power. Constructing one involves the employment of mighty magic and elemental forces.  The animating force for a golem is a spirit. The process of creating the golem binds the unwilling spirit to the artificial body and subjects it to the will of the golem’s creator.

Name: Squirming Mound
Power 2 - Action: immediate (react), when an enemy misses the mound with a melee attack
Power 2 - Effect: the target’s weapon is ripped from its grasp and lands 1d6 squares away in a random direction.
Power 3 - Action: immediate (react), the mound is hit with a melee attack
Power 3 - Effect: The target takes 1d6+2 poison damage.
Power 4 - Effect: The mound shifts 1 square.

Name: Wicker Golem
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+3 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 2 - Attack: Affects a target the wicker golem is grappling; +4 vs. Fortitude
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+6 damage.

Name: Vigilant Statue
Aura: *Suppressive Aura (Necrotic) aura 2:* Enemies in the aura only regain half the standard amount of hit points from healing effects.
Power 2 - Effect: The vigilant statue makes two slam attacks. A target hit by both attacks is pushed 2 squares and knocked prone.
Power 3 - Effect: 3d8+2 psychic damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the vigilant statue’s next turn.
Power 4 - Effect: the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).
Power 5 - Effect: A vigilant statue is instantly aware of all creatures entering or leaving its enshrined area. It does not know the exact location of intruders, but is aware of their presence, making it all but impossible to surprise.

Name: # Hags
Description: Hags are cruel witches from the Plane of Faerie.

Name: Blood-Drinker Hag
Power 2 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape).
Power 3 - Effect: The hag makes a *claw* and a *toothed tongue* attack in either order.
Power 4 - Effect: The hag deals 1d6+2 necrotic damage to a grappled target. She gains temporary hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt to the target.
Power 5 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, and the target is grappled (until escape). The hag can grapple up to three targets with hungry tongues.
Power 6 - Effect: The hag gains a +2 bonus to all defenses while she is grappling one or more foes.

Name: Ice Hag
Senses: low-light vision, can see through concealment granted by magical or mundane precipitation
Aura: *Unceasing Sleet (Cold) aura 1:* Squares in aura are heavily obscured and creatures that enter or begin their turns in the aura take 1d6 cold damage.
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+6 damage, and the ice hag shifts 2 squares (usually up).
Power 3 - Attack: When the ice hag is hit with a melee attack; +17 vs. AC
Power 3 - Effect: 3d8+5 damage, and the target is blinded (save ends).
Power 4 - Effect: The ice hag flies up to 10 squares and makes two claw attacks at any point during that movement. It can combine the attacks on one target or attack multiple targets, and does not provoke opportunity attacks when moving away from the first target.
Power 5 - Effect: An ice hag can alter their physical form to appear as an old wolf or an old woman of any Medium humanoid race.

Name: # Humans
Description: Humans need no introduction. These profiles can be easily adapted to represent other humanoids, like high elves, wood elves, half-orcs, half-elves, tieflings, dragonborn and dwarves.

Name: Bodyguard
Power 2 - Effect: 2d4+3 damage, and the target is knocked prone.

Name: Chain Brawler
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+3 damage (1d6+6 vs. prone target). The chain brawler can choose to knock the target prone instead of inflicting damage.

Name: Ill-Equipped Combatant
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Effect: 5 damage.

Name: Warden
Power 2 - Effect: 1d6+3 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: 1d4+1 damage.
Power 3 - Secondary Attack: Strength vs Reflex, on a hit target immobilised (save ends).
Power 4 - Effect: 1d6+3 damage, and the warden shunts the target 1 square.
Power 5 - Effect: The warden deals an additional 1d6 damage against any target it has combat advantage against.

Name: Clubman
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*

Name: Grenadier
Power 2 - Effect: The grenadier shifts 3 squares and makes a *grenade* attack.
Power 3 - Attack: Far burst 2 within 15 (creatures in burst); +8 vs. Reflex
Power 3 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage.

Name: Siege Engineer
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+3 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: 2d10+3 damage; must be adjacent to another siege engineer, and at a ballista to use.

Name: Daggermaster
Power 2 - Effect: The qualified combatant may make two *knife* attacks.

Name: Knifer
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*

Name: Scurvy Pirate
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+2 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: 1d6+7 damage, and target is knocked prone.
Power 4 - Attack: When a foe moves or shifts within reach; Reach 2; +8 vs. Fortitude
Power 4 - Effect: target ends its movement, losing its action (although it can take another action to continue moving).
Equipment: leather armor, boat hook, crossbow, case with 10 bolts

Name: Shadowblast Warlock
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+6 damage; Ap 5, and the target is immobile (save ends).
Power 3 - Effect: 2d8 +6 damage, and the target is dazed (save ends); *Miss:*  The bell-tower bastard regains the use of this power

Name: Gang Leader
Power 1 - Effect: 2d6+5 damage, and the target is knocked prone.
Power 2 - Effect: Allies in a Near burst 4 can make a saving throw or make a basic attack.
Power 3 - Effect: One ally in a Near burst 5 shift 3 squares.
Power 4 - Effect: An ally is staggered: All allies in line of sight of the cell lieutenant shift 3 squares.

Name: Gang Member
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 1 - Effect: 7 damage, and the target is pushed 1 square.  If the target cannot be pushed, it takes 2 extra damage.
Power 2 - Effect: 8 damage.

Name: Snake Bearer
Power 2 - Effect: 5 damage, and the snake bearer makes a secondary attack on the same target.
Power 2 - Secondary Attack: +7 vs. Fortitude; persistent 5 poison damage (save ends).

Name: Cowled Assassin
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+6 damage, and the target takes persistent 5 damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: Until the cowled assassin hits with his concealed knife, he gains a +3 bonus to all defenses and a +3 bonus to Bluff and Intimidate skill checks.
Power 3 - Effect: Shift 4 squares and gain a +1 bonus to AC until the start of the cowled assassin's next turn.
Power 4 - Effect: The target grants combat advantage to all allied adversaries of the same type as the cowled assassin until the start of the cowled assassin's next turn.

Name: Repeater Crossbow Master
Power 2 - Attack: Far wall 4 (range 25/50); +10 vs. Reflex (each creature in wall)
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+6 damage.

Name: Repeater Crossbowman
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Attack: The repeater crossbowman hits with *repeater crossbow* this turn: The repeater crossbowman makes one *repeater crossbow* attack against one enemy within 2 squares of the original target.

Name: Hulk
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+6 damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the hulk's next turn.
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+7 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: The hulk saves from any and all of the following conditions: dazed, immobile (but not if restrained), slowed and weakened.

Name: Wolfshead Bandit
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*

Name: King of Thieves
Aura: *Sleep When You’re Dead aura 5:* When an ally in the aura is staggered or reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, it makes a basic attack. If at 0 hit points or lower, the target drops after the attack.
Power 2 - Effect: The king of thieves hits with a *crossbow* attack: The king of thieves makes a *crossbow* attack. This repeats until the king of thieves misses or hits 4 times.
Power 3 - Effect: The king of thieves is hit: The attacker must re-roll their attack and take the lower result.

Name: Sniper Bandit
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 1 - Effect: 6 damage, and the target is knocked prone.
Power 2 - Attack: Shifts 4 squares then attack. Ranged 10/20; +9 vs. AC; 6 damage, and the target is knocked prone.

Name: Fire Magician
Aura: *Smoke 'Em if You've Got 'Em (fire) aura 1:* Enemies in the aura when the fire magician uses their *scorching ray* or *fire wall* attacks suffers 5 fire damage.
Power 1 - Attack: Near arc 5; +15 vs. Reflex (each creature in arc)
Power 1 - Effect: 2d6+5 damage, and the target takes persistent 5 fire damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Attack: Far wall 5 within 10; +15 vs. Reflex (each creature in wall)
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6 +5 damage, and the target takes persistent 5 fire damage (save ends).

Name: Longbowman
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Effect: The longbowman makes a *longbow* attack.

Name: Insidious Assassin
Power 1 - Effect: 2d8+8 damage, and the target is weakened (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: The insidious assassin deals 8 extra damage against targets that grant the insidious assassin combat advantage.
Power 3 - Effect: Shift to any adjacent square of an adjacent enemy and all adjacent enemies grant the insidious assassin combat advantage.
Power 4 - Effect: The insidious assassin hits a target granting combat advantage to the insidious assassin: The target takes persistent 5 damage until the end of the encounter or until the target drops.

Name: Martial Artist
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Effect: The martial artist gains a +2 bonus to AC and Reflex defense and shifts 1 square.

Name: Mercenary Lord
Power 2 - Effect: All allied creatures in the encounter gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls and saving throws. If the mercenary lord is killed, all allied creatures suffer a -2 penalty to damage rolls and saving throws until the end of the encounter.
Power 3 - Effect: The mercenary lord makes two *crossbow* attacks.
Power 4 - Effect: One non-elite, non-boss ally regains hit points equal to one quarter the target’s original hit points.
Power 5 - Effect: One ally makes a basic attack. If that ally misses, select another ally to make a basic attack. Only one ally can make a basic attack this way per round.
Power 6 - Effect: The mercenary lord is hit by a ranged attack: One ally within 4 squares swaps location with the mercenary lord and suffers the hit instead.

Name: Dark Knight
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+6, and the target is stunned until the start of the dark knight's next turn.
Power 3 - Effect: The dark knight makes two *mancatcher* attacks.
Power 4 - Effect: The dark knight inflicts 3d6+11 damage to any target it is grappling.
Power 5 - Effect: If the dark knight is staggered, it regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn.
Power 6 - Effect: The dark knight cannot be dazed, marked, or weakened.

Name: Armored Warmage
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+18 damage.
Power 3 - Attack: Far burst 5 within 40; +15 vs. Reflex (each creature in burst)
Power 3 - Effect: 1d8+14 damage and the target is marked until the armored warmage is dropped.

Name: Master Assassin
Power 1 - Effect: 2d8+6 damage, and the master assassin follow up with an identical attack. The master assassin can repeat this until they hit 3 times.
Power 2 - Effect: 3d6+10 damage, and the target takes persistent 1 damage until the end of the encounter or until the target drops. This damage is cumulative with successive hits with hand crossbow (maximum persistent 10 damage).
Power 3 - Effect: When the master assassin benefits from any cover or concealment, enemies suffer an additional -2 penalty to attack him.
Power 4 - Effect: When the master assassin scores a critical hit, they gain an action point.
Power 5 - Attack: Near arc 8; +15 vs.  Reflex (all enemies in arc)
Power 5 - Effect: 2d6+6 and the target is slowed (save ends).
Power 6 - Effect: The master assassin shifts 4 squares and can make a Stealth check.

Name: Martial Arts Master
Power 1 - Effect: 3d6+10 damage, and the target is knocked prone.
Power 2 - Attack: Near burst 1 (all creatures in burst); +16 vs. Reflex
Power 2 - Effect: 2d8+7 damage, and the target is dazed until the start of the martial arts master’s next turn.
Power 3 - Effect: 3d6+10 damage, and the target is rendered unconscious (save ends).  If the target suffers any damage, it is no longer unconscious.
Power 4 - Effect: When the martial arts master runs, they gain a +4 bonus to AC and Reflex defense. When they charge, they do not miss on the attack roll.
Power 5 - Effect: 3d6+12 damage, and the target is dazed, slowed, and weakened (save ends each).

Name: Berserker
Power 2 - Effect: 3d8+12 damage, and the target grappled.
Power 3 - Effect: The berserker shifts 4 squares and gains 10 temporary hit points.
Power 4 - Attack: +19 vs. AC (must be grappling the target)
Power 4 - Effect: 3d8+12 damage and the target is dazed and takes persistent 5 damage (save ends both).

Name: Blademaster
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Effect: The blademaster gains a +2 bonus to attack and makes a *longsword* attack.  They then suffer a -2 penalty to AC and Reflex defense until the start of their next turn.

Name: Formidable Archer
Power 2 - Effect: 3d6+15 damage and the target is weakened or slowed (save ends).
Power 3 - Effect: The formidable archer hits with their next *composite longbow* attack this turn.
Power 4 - Effect: The formidable archer hits with a *composite longbow* attack: The triggered attack is a critical hit.

Name: Archvillain
Power 1 - Effect: 3d8+11 damage and, the target is knocked prone.
Power 2 - Effect: 3d6+8 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: At the start of its turn, if the archvillain is not staggered, they regain 5 hit points.
Power 4 - Effect: When an enemy scores a critical hit on the big boss, the archvillain suffers 20 extra damage.
Power 5 - Attack: Far burst 1 in 10 (all creatures in burst); +19 vs. Reflex
Power 5 - Effect: 3d6+8 damage and the target is knocked prone and dazed stunned until the start of the archvillain's next turn.
Power 6 - Effect: The archvillain is reduced to 0 hit points or lower: The archvillain regains 190 hit points and all their standard actions are reduced to move actions.

Name: Veteran Crossbowman
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Effect: The pistol packer can shift a square as a swift action.

Name: Longshot Berserker
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Effect: The longshot berserker is hit with an attack: The attack misses.

Name: # Infected
Description: The Infected come about because of a disease, which creates lesions, warts, and boils on the skin as well as causing inflammation within the brain. Those infected think only of eating and destroying. The disease is extremely infectious and can render the target violently ill for days or weeks, bringing them near the point of death, but most of those infected make a full recovery - if they are given time.

Name: Infected Animal
HP Extras: see also *nerve shot*
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+6 damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it is knocked prone.
Power 2 - Effect: Any critical hit to the Infected animal reduces it to 0 hit points instantly.
Power 3 - Effect: The Infected animal ignores any marks if there is an adjacent prone enemy.
Power 4 - Effect: 1d8+6 damage, and the target is immobile until the start of the Infected animal's next turn.
Description: Infected animals are mostly dogs with the occasional bear thrown in. They prefer running at full speed, pouncing an opponent with the basic strike, and then keeping them in place by raking at them constantly.

Name: Infected Drone
HP Extras: see also *nerve shot*
Power 2 - Effect: Any critical hit to the Infected drone reduces it to 0 hit points instantly.
Power 3 - Effect: The speed of the Infected drone increases to 6 until the end of its turn.
Power 4 - Attack: Trigger:  An enemy leaves an adjacent square; +5 vs. Reflex
Power 4 - Effect: The target is unable to move from the square.
Description: The infected drone was a normal human but has become physically larger due to the mutation.

Name: Infected Guard
HP Extras: see also *nerve shot*
Power 2 - Effect: Any critical hit to the Infected guard reduces it to 0 hit points instantly.
Power 3 - Effect: If the Infected guard scores a critical hit, it knocks the opponent prone and can immediately follow up with a slam attack.
Power 4 - Attack: Trigger:  An enemy leaves an adjacent square; +5 vs. Reflex
Power 4 - Effect: The target is unable to move from the square.
Power 5 - Effect: The guard is hit: The guard takes no damage and is dazed until the end of its next turn.
Description: Infected guards were soldiers or guards who were infected while they were still in armor. They are also physically larger.

Name: Infected Grub
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Effect: At the start of the grub’s turn, it regains 10 hit points.
Description: Infected grubs are normal humans infected by the virus. They prefer running towards a target and ripping it apart.

Name: Infected Behemoth
Power 1 - Effect: 2d8+7 damage or 2d6+5 damage, and the target is grappled.
Power 2 - Attack: Far burst 2 within 20 (each creature in burst); +11 vs. Reflex
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+5 damage, and the target is knocked prone.
Power 3 - Attack: Reach 2; +13 vs. AC (one creature it is grappling)
Power 3 - Effect: 2d8+7 damage, and the target is dazed and weakened (save ends both).
Description: The behemoth has had their body and muscles expand until they reach a massive size. The behemoth will use debris throw (if no debris is readily to hand, it will rip up a chunk of tarmac or a large rock) to knock down opponents and run up to fallen targets to use hulk rend.

Name: # Invaders
Description:
The Invaders represent an alien invasion. This mixing of genres will not suite all fantasy campaigns, but it has been a part of the hobby since the very beginning. The Invaders may be merely an exploratory force, or a misdirected unit intended for a fight on another planet, or the full force of an interstellar armada. In any case, the creatures outlined here represent bodies (also called "shells") cobbled together by the aliens from supplies on their spaceship and whatever materials - inorganic and otherwise - that they find. 

The invasion force consists of “skinner” shock troops and “widows”, which provide command and control. Mobile artillery units are called “chanks” and the flying vehicles are “screamers”. There are also rarely seen larger “beast” mobile strongpoints.

The Invaders have basic intelligence and, with the help of a widow, can coordinate their actions and formulate tactics. However, their overarching strategy of the entire force depends on the “Tri-Pod”—the alien commander.

Name: Punk
Power 1 - Effect: 2d8+7 damage, and the target is pushed 1 square.
Power 2 - Effect: 3d6+13 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: The punk must hit with its weapon arm this turn: The punk makes another weapon arm attack.
Power 4 - Effect: The punk makes a slam attack.
Power 5 - Effect: Ignore cover provided by thast source.
Power 6 - Effect: The punk must hit with its weapon arm using chaos fire: The punk makes another weapon arm attack.
Description: The punk is a larger infantry support unit with four legs, capable of laying down heavy fire against single or multiple targets. What's left of its organic head has been supplanted with considerable tracking equipment to pinpoint distant targets. The punk is also often seen an anti-aircraft weapon. It is often flanked by at least a half-dozen skinners.

Name: Skinner
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 2 - Effect: The skinner is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points by a non-critical hit: The skinner regains one hit point.  It can stand up on its turn.
Description: Skinners are jumbled collections of cybernetic and organic parts.  They are produced in the thousands from on-site materials.

Name: Beast
Power 2 - Effect: Place six corpses within a Near burst 10 around the beast at the start of the encounter. The beast must be in an adjacent square to a body to create a skinner.
Power 3 - Effect: 2d8+7 damage, and the target suffers persistent 1 damage until the end of the encounter.
Power 4 - Attack: Near burst 1 (within 20/40); +16 vs. Reflex (each creature in burst)
Power 4 - Effect: 2d8+7 damage, and the target suffers persistent 5 fire damage (save ends).
Power 5 - Effect: 3d6+13 damage, the target is pulled into an adjacent square, and the beast immediately makes a *gray infection* attack.
Power 6 - Effect: Target one adjacent corpse or killed creature. The target is replaced with a skinner. A skinner placed this way acts on the beast’s initiative and can act immediately after being placed.
Power 7 - Effect: Select one enemy suffering from persistent damage from grey infection.  Increase the persistent damage by 1.
Description: Also known as a conversion unit, the beast is a mobile command node that expands the Invaders' influence and sphere of control. Although capable of combat, the beast prefers to remain back, while constructing more Invaders. While fixed and defended facilities produce larger units like screamers and punks, beasts expand though uncontrolled and populated areas producing ground units as fast as they can acquire raw materials. To destroy one is to cripple the enemy advancement in that area. Unfortunately, beasts are incredibly difficult to defeat. Unlike many Invaders, the beast, although cybernetic, has no visible human features.

Name: Chank
Power 1 - Attack: Far burst 1 (within 5 and 120); +19 vs. Reflex (each creatures in burst)
Power 1 - Effect: 2d8+8 damage (Ap10), and the target is knocked prone. *Miss:* Half damage.
Power 2 - Attack: Far burst 1 (within 5 and 120); +19 vs. Reflex (each creatures in burst)
Power 2 - Secondary Attack: The target is pushed 4 squares. If the target cannot be pushed 4 squares, it takes 2d8+8 damage. Buildings, objects, non-moving vehicles, and terrain take 40 points of damage.
Power 3 - Effect: As long as there is at least one ally adjacent to the chank, the chank is immune to being immobile, knocked prone, pushed, slowed or marked.
Power 4 - Effect: Increase the damage of the chank's next *self propelled plasma artillery system* attack by 1d8.
Power 5 - Effect: The chank is reduced to zero hit points or fewer: The chank makes a *perimeter blast* attack.
Description: This unfortunately nicknamed cybernetic mobile artillery unit is only seen coupled with larger units. It has few organic components in its assembly, mostly consisting of recoil absorption hardware and armament. As the chank has no close combat capacity, it depends on its guards to protect it.

Name: Mother Screamer
Power 2 - Effect: The screamer does not provoke opportunity attacks when attacking. The screamer is immune to all hits from attacks made from 30 squares away or more.
Power 3 - Effect: Place a screamer baby in an adjacent square. The mother can only have three baby units in the encounter at a time. A baby placed this way acts on the mother's initiative and can act immediately after being placed.
Power 4 - Effect: Shift 2 squares.
Description: Screamer is an umbrella term for one-manned aircraft operated by the shells. Both are considered attack vehicles as neither can be used as a transport. The smaller screamer is used in close quarters as a high-ground support platform for ground based infantry shells while the larger one is an anti-vehicle / crowd disposal device. The only organic compound used in the screamer is a brain (the baby often sports an exposed human skull).

Name: The Tri-Pod
Power 1 - Effect: 24 damage. This is considered a critical hit. Spirit does not provoke opportunity attacks with its heat ray. Spirit cannot use heat ray on a creature it is grappling.
Power 2 - Effect: Spirit is immune to all damage until a **single hit** inflicts 50 damage or more.
Power 3 - Effect: Spirit makes two *heat ray* attacks.  They cannot target the same creature.
Power 4 - Effect: 2d8+8 damage, and the target is either grappled or pushed 6 squares. If the target hits an obstruction, it takes 2d8 additional damage.
Power 5 - Attack: Reach 4; +18 vs. Fortitude (one creature Spirit is grappling)
Power 5 - Effect: 3d6+13 damage.
Power 6 - Effect: Spirit is reduced to 0 hit points or lower: Spirit’s force field is re-activated; it stands up (if prone) and regains 300 hit points.
Description: Spirit, the Invader commander, is locked in a three-legged mobile command robot known inventively as the Tri-Pod.

Name: Widow
Power 2 - Effect: One skinner in the encounter makes a basic attack and automatically hits its target.
Power 3 - Effect: Place one skinner in an adjacent square.
Power 4 - Effect: One skinner in the encounter can shift one square and make a basic attack as a swift action on its turn. Can select a new skinner as the target of this stance as a swift action.
Description: The widow is an advanced skinner that has the capacity to influence if not outright control the skinners around it. The widow has very few organic components, sometimes as little as 2%. It also doesn’t always completely follow the humanoid form. Some have synthetic tentacles while others have multiple legs. Individual units have been nicknamed “scorpion,” ”centaur, ” “tarantula,” and “octopus".

Name: Baby Screamer
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook; see also *rugged*
Power 1 - Effect: 10 damage, and the screamer can shift one square.
Power 2 - Effect: Shift 2 squares.
Power 3 - Effect: An enemy hits the screamer: The screamer shifts one square, and the attack misses.

Name: # Juggernauts
Description: Juggernauts are the golem-like constructs created by a long-ago empire. Each juggernaut has room in its torso for a humanoid rider, who can direct the juggernaut.

Name: The Minotaur
Power 2 - Effect: 2d8+6 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: The minotaur is immune to opportunity attacks. When the minotaur moves, it ignores difficult terrain and squares occupied by enemies. Shunt enemies in squares the minotaur enters 1 square. The minotaur cannot be knocked prone.
Power 4 - Effect: The minotaur shifts up to 9 squares in a straight line. The minotaur makes a *slam* attack against each enemy in reach during this movement. On a hit, the target is knocked prone. The minotaur can only attack each target once.
Power 5 - Effect: The minotaur is staggered: The minotaur immediately stands up if prone and recovers from all conditions it suffers from. The minotaur makes an *iron onslaught* attack.
Description: The original use of the Minotaur was to breach walls and other defenses during siege warfare.

Name: The Emperor
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+6 damage and the target is knocked prone.
Power 2 - Effect: 2d8+8 damage.
Power 3 - Effect: The emperor flies 7 squares and makes 3 *lightning shot* attacks.
Power 4 - Effect: 2d6+6 damage.
Power 5 - Effect: The emperor is staggered: The emperor’s ground and fly speed increases by 1, is healed to full hit points and loses all resistances.
Description: The Emperor is built in the shape of a gigantic, powerful human. The exposed copper and bronze wires that make up its artificial musculature give it the appearance of a skinless, gleaming gold giant floating through the air.

Name: The Awoken
Power 1 - Effect: 3d8+13 damage, and the target is pushed 3 squares or grappled.
Power 2 - Effect: 3d6+13, and the target takes persistent 10 damage (save ends).
Power 3 - Effect: The Awoken cannot be marked, dominated, or surprised.
Power 4 - Attack: Far burst 3 within 20/40; +18 vs. Reflex (all creatures in burst)
Power 4 - Effect: 2d8+8, and the target takes persistent 10 fire damage (save ends).
Power 5 - Attack: Reach 2; +18 vs. Fortitude (one creature the Awoken is grappling)
Power 5 - Effect: 3d6+13, and the target takes persistent 10 damage (save ends).
Power 7 - Effect: The Awoken gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls and can ignore difficult terrain until the start of the Awoken's next turn.
Power 8 - Effect: The Awoken gains a +1 bonus to all defenses until the start of the Awoken's next turn and can shift 1 square.
Description: The Awoken is the only juggernaut in recorded history to become self-aware, and able to direct itself without a rider in its torso.

Name: The Scorpion
Power 1 - Effect: 3d6+13 damage, and the target is pushed 3 squares and knocked prone.
Power 2 - Effect: 3d6+13 damage and the target is knocked prone.
Power 3 - Effect: The Harm cannot be knocked prone or subject to unwilling movement.
Power 4 - Attack: Near burst 2 (all creatures in burst); +19 vs. AC
Power 4 - Effect: 2d8+8 damage, and the target is pushed 3 squares and knocked prone.
Power 5 - Effect: The Harm makes a *lightning shot* attack.  If it hits, it makes a second attack against the same target.
Power 6 - Attack: Far burst within 30/60; +20 vs. Reflex (all creatures in burst)
Power 6 - Effect: 3d6+10 and the target is knocked prone.
Power 7 - Effect: The scorpion cannot move or be moved until it deactivates deployment. Its AC increases to 29 but its Reflex defense decreases to 24. The scorpion can no longer make *heavy piton leg* or *thunder fall* attacks.
Description: The Scorpion is in the shape of a many-legged insect, but with the animated stone and bronze of the other juggernauts. The rider must lie supine in the "body" of the Scorpion, in a small dark room called the "coffin".

Name: Witchcrawler
Power 2 - Attack: Near burst 5; targets enemies; +7 vs. Reflex
Power 2 - Effect: the target is restrained and takes persistent 10 damage (save ends both).
Power 3 - Effect: A witchcrawler can compress its body enough to squeeze through a 1-inch-wide crack. Cracks and other openings that are more than 1 inch wide do not slow the witchcrawler at all.

Name: Ogre Wretch
HP Extras: missed attack never damages a mook

Name: Burrower Wurm
Power 1 - Effect: 2d8+6 damage, and the target is knocked prone
Power 2 - Effect: The wurm moves below the surface up to its burrow speed, avoiding opportunity attacks, and then bursts up from the ground and makes a bite attack with combat advantage: +17 vs. AC; 2d8+6 damage, and the target is grappled.
Power 3 - Effect: 1d8+5 damage.

Name: # Oozes
Description: Oozes are amorphous creatures.

Name: Shapeshifter Slime - Human Form
Power 2 - Effect: 2d4+4 force damage.
Power 3 - Effect: When first staggered: the monster regresses to its natural form.
Description: The shapeshifter slime begins in human form. Once sufficiently damaged, it transforms into its original ooze form. You get separate XP for defeating each form.

Name: Shapeshifter Slime - Slime Form
Power 2 - Effect: Any time the monster takes cold damage, it is slowed (save ends). If the effect that caused the cold damage also causes the target to become slowed, ignore this ability.

Name: # Plane of Shadow
Description: The Plane of Shadow coexists alongside the Prime Material Plane, the world. It is a twisted shadow of the world.

Name: Shadow Bat Swarm
Aura: *Aura 1:* The shadow bat swarm makes a basic attack as a free action against each enemy that begins its turn in the aura.
HP Extras: Regeneration 5
Resistance to: cold 5, necrotic 5, Melee and Ranged attacks (half damage)
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, persistent 2 cold and necrotic damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, and the target is blinded (save ends).
Power 3 - Effect: The shadow bat swarm heals 5 points of damage per round as long as an allied monster lives.

Name: Shadow Drake
HP Extras: see also *umbra burst*
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, persistent 5 cold and necrotic damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: 1d6+4 damage, and the target is knocked prone.
Power 3 - Effect: The umbra drake makes a bite and a tail slap attack. If both attacks strike the same target, the target is weakened (save ends).
Power 4 - Effect: 1d12+3 damage, and the target takes 5 persistent cold and necrotic damage and is blinded (save ends all).
Power 5 - Attack: when reduced to 0 or fewer hit points; Near burst 1; +6 vs. Fortitude
Power 5 - Effect: 3d6+3 cold and necrotic damage, and the target is weakened.

Name: Umbral Mass
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+3 cold and necrotic damage and the target is grappled (until escape). The umbral mass deals an automatic 1d8+3 damage at the beginning of its  turn each round it maintains the grapple.
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+2 psychic damage, and the target is weakened and slowed (save ends both).
Power 3 - Effect: 1d8+3 cold and necrotic damage.
Power 4 - Effect: The range of the umbral mass's opportunity attacks is its reach (3).

Name: Flying Head
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+4 necrotic damage, and the flying head makes a secondary attack on the same target.
Power 1 - Secondary Attack: +8 vs. Fortitude; the target loses the ability to regain hit points until the end of the encounter.
Power 2 - Effect: The flying head flies up to 7. At one point during the movement, they can make one melee basic attack. Moving away from the target of the attack does not provoke opportunity attacks.
Power 3 - Effect: The target is immobile (save ends). *First Failed Save:* The target is stunned (save ends).

Name: Shadow Prince
Aura: *Shadow Haze aura 1:* Enemies that end or start their turn in the aura take 5 points of necrotic damage.
HP Extras: see also *shadow burst*
Power 1 - Effect: 2d4+4 damage, persistent 2 cold and necrotic damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: 1d12+4 fire damage.
Power 3 - Effect: 10 necrotic damage, and all undead and creatures with the shadow ancestry within the burst regain 10 hit points.
Power 4 - Effect: the Shadow Prince can teleport a single ally 3 squares.

Name: Flying Head Swarm
Aura: *Swarm Attack aura 3:* The swarm makes a basic attack as a free action against each enemy that begins its turn in the aura.
Resistance to: necrotic 20, Melee and Ranged attacks (half damage)
Power 1 - Effect: 3d8+12 necrotic damage, persistent 10 necrotic damage (save ends), and the swarm makes a secondary attack on the same target.
Power 1 - Secondary Attack: +32 vs. Fortitude; the target loses 2 healing surges and the ability to regain hit points (save ends, but with a –2 penalty to the roll).
Power 2 - Attack: The swarm attacks up to three Medium or smaller targets; +32 vs. Reflex (automatically hits an immobile or stunned creature)
Power 2 - Effect: On a hit, the target is grappled and pulled into the swarm’s space; the target is dazed and takes persistent 20 necrotic damage and may not regain hit points until it escapes the grapple. A creature that escapes the grapple shifts to a square of its choice adjacent to the swarm. The swarm can move normally while creatures are engulfed within it.
Power 3 - Effect: 4d8+4 psychic damage, and the target is immobile (save ends). *First Failed Save:* The target is stunned (save ends).

Name: # Undead
Description: Undead are those creatures that were once alive; whether what remains is the deceased's body, spirit or soul.

Name: Smoldering Skeleton
Power 2 - Effect: 1d8+3 fire damage, and persistent 2 fire damage (save ends).

Name: Failed Sacrifice
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+5 damage, and the target is weakened (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: The failed sacrifice makes two claw attacks against a single target. If both attacks hit, the target takes an additional 5 damage and the failed sacrifice regains 5 hit points.
Power 3 - Effect: The failed sacrifice gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls.

Name: Slaugh (Skeletal Revenant)
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+5 damage, and the target takes persistent 5 necrotic damage (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: The slaugh makes two claw attacks. If both claw attacks hit the same target, the target is knocked prone.
Power 3 - Effect: The slaugh vomits forth a cloud of screaming, shadowy bats. The cloud grants concealment to all creatures within it and blocks line of sight. Any enemy within the cloud that makes a Ranged or Far attack suffers an opportunity attack, 1d4+1 damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to all attack rolls until the end of its next turn. The cloud persists until the end of the encounter.

Name: Specter of Chivalry
Power 1 - Effect: 1d8+2 necrotic damage, and the target is marked until the end of the knightly spectre's next turn.
Power 2 - Effect: A knightly spectre has combat advantage against any target marked by any ghostly sword power.

Name: Specter of Sorrow
Aura: *Regretful Whispers (Psychic) aura 1:* Any enemy that enters or starts its turn in the aura takes 5 psychic damage and cannot shift until the start of its next turn. If the spectre of sorrow takes radiant damage, the aura is negated until the end of its next turn.
Power 1 - Effect: 1d6+5 psychic damage, and the target takes –2 penalty to Will defense (save ends).
Power 2 - Effect: 2d6+4 psychic damage, and target is weakened (save ends).
Power 3 - Effect: Any humanoid killed by a wraith of sorrow rises as a free-willed basic wraith (use these stats, but without the regretful whispers power) at the start of its creator’s next turn, appearing in the space where it died (or nearest unoccupied space).

Name: Zombified Wyvern
Power 2 - Attack: The wyvern zombie can attack with its claws only while flying; +10 vs. AC
Power 2 - Effect: 1d10+5 damage, and the target is knocked prone.
Power 3 - Effect: 1d8+5 damage, and persistent 5 necrotic damage.

Name: Greater Failed Sacrifice
Power 1 - Effect: 2d8+7 damage, and the target is weakened (save ends) and grappled (until escape).
Power 2 - Effect: 4d8+7 damage, and the greater failed sacrifice regains 10 hit points. If this power reduces a target to 0 hit points or fewer, the greater failed sacrifice rips out the target’s heart, killing it instantly.
Power 3 - Effect: The greater failed sacrifice gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls and can take an extra standard action each round.
